key_title: Key to the species of Ophioglossum

Key to the genera of Ophioglossaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stipe base persistent; rhizome long, conical, with numerous wiry pale yellow-brown roots, mainly vertical
Stipe base not persistent; rhizome usually short, with a few brittle dark brown roots, mainly horizontal
Lamina lanceolate, ovate-lanceolate or less commonly short-elliptic, somewhat fleshy, venation indistinct; fertile spike with 6–15 pairs of sporangia
Lamina ovate, membranous, primary veins very distinct; fertile spike with 11–28 pairs of sporangia
